description: Development of a bus depot comprising 1,415m2 building for bus maintenance (with ancillary staff facilities and site administration), a bus washing and refuelling area, together with landscaping, bus, car parking and cycle storage provision
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing number(s) C-164-TP2-LP-01, C-164-TP2-01-B, C-164-TP2-02-C, and C-164-TP2-03-B, 730.19.01 and the following documents:

Planning Statement (prepared by Savills, dated October 2017); Design & Access Statement Rev C (prepared by Ian C King and Associates, dated 5 October 2017); Schedule of External Building Materials (prepared by Ian C King Associates, dated September 2017); Transport Assessment (prepared by Paul Basham Associates, dated October 2017); Travel Plan (prepared by Paul Basham Associates, dated September 2017); Noise Assessment (prepared by TRC dated September 2017); Air Quality Screening Statement (prepared by TRC dated September 2017); Energy and Sustainability Strategy (prepared by Cudd Bentley dated September 2017); Breeam Pre-Assessment (prepared by Cudd Bentley dated September 2017); Ecological Assessment (prepared by Ecology Solutions dated September 2016); Tree Survey and 718.TS.01 prepared by Terry Anderson Landscape Architects; Flood Risk Assessment (prepared by Bradbrook dated September 2017); Additional Site Investigation and Detailed Quantitative Risk Assessment (prepared by Ramboll dated September 2017), Remediation Plan & Monitoring Strategy (prepared by Ramboll dated September 2017), External Lighting Assessment (prepared by Cudd Bentley dated September 2017), Sustainability Appraisal (dated September 2017),  Fleet Profile Bus Movements & Staff (dated September 2017).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| The materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development indicated and specified on the Schedule of External Building Materials (prepared by Ian C King Associates, dated September 2017) shall be in place prior to occupation of the development hereby approved and thereafter retained.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surroundings, in accordance with policies 7B and Ealing Local Variation to London Policy 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policies 1.1 (h) and 1.2 (g) of the Development Strategy 2026 DPD (2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).

| The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage, in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards, has been provided in an accessible location and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, policy 7B of the Adopted Ealing Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policies 7.4, and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).

| Sheltered and secure cycle parking as shown on approved plan C-164-TP2-01-B and in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards shall be in place prior to first occupation of the development hereby permitted and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for cycle parking.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016).

| The parking arrangements for vehicles (including three disabled parking bays) shown on drawing No. C-164-TP2-01 B shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available and shall not be used for any other purpose. No additional car parking shall be formed or made available.

Reason: To ensure that there is adequate parking provision within the site and to ensure that excessive parking is not provided, in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016); and section 4 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Prior to the first occupation of the approved development at least 2 of the approved parking spaces shall be implemented to provide active electric vehicle charging points. The remaining 8 spaces with active charging points shall be implemented as such within 6 months of the first occupation of the development and maintained thereafter.

Reason: In the interest of the environment and improving air quality in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and policies 6.13 and 7.14 of the London Plan (2016).

| The development hereby permitted shall be built and operated in accordance with the submitted Travel Plan (September 2017) and any details approved subsequently by the Council as a local planning authority pursuant to any conditions on this decision letter.

Reason: To promote sustainable patterns of transport to safeguard the living and working conditions of local people and in the interest of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with section 4 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2016 and policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026.

| Notwithstanding any approved documents, prior to the commencement of any works on site (except demolition and site clearance) the following shall be submitted to and subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority:

(a)	A remediation (de-contamination) scheme to bring the site to a condition suitable for the intended end use. It shall include all works to be undertaken, proposed remediation objectives and remediation criteria, timetable of works and site management procedures.  The scheme must ensure that the site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the intended use of the land after remediation.
Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation (de-contamination) scheme pursuant to part (a):

(b)	A verification report that demonstrates the completion of measures identified in the approved contamination remediation scheme shall be produced. The report shall be compiled in accordance with the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1'.

Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of occupiers in accordance policy 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012); and policy 5.21 of The London Plan (2016).

| The external sound level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment at the development hereby approved shall be lower than the existing background sound level by at least 10 dBA as measured at the nearest and/or most affected noise sensitive premises in order to prevent any adverse impact, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity, as assessed in accordance with BS4142:2014.

Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of occupants of adjoining properties in accordance policy 5.21 of The London Plan, policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and the National Planning Policy Framework.

| The non-residential development shall be registered with Building Research Establishment (BRE), achieve BREEAM Rating Very Good and make reasonable endeavours to achieve Excellent (based on the latest BREEAM NC Technical guidance).

i.	Within 3 months of completion of the development, Interim BREEAM NC Assessment and related Certification verified by the BRE shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

ii.	Within 6 months from the date of first occupation of the development, BREEAM 'Post Construction Stage' Assessment and related Certification verified by the BRE should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval confirming the BREEAM standard and measures have been implemented.

Following any approval of a 'Post Construction Stage' assessment and certificate of the development, the approved measures and technologies to achieve the BREEAM Very Good or higher standard shall be retained in working order for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan (2016), policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and policies 5.2 and 7A of  the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Upon the first occupation of the development, the approved development shall incorporate sustainability measures as detailed in the approved Energy and Sustainability Statement V2 (26 September 2017), Bream Pre-Assessment V3 (16 February 2018) additional information (30 January, 1 February & 20 February 2018) prepared by Cudd Bentley Consulting Ltd and Ecology Solutions.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2016, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012.

| A) Six months prior to the practical completion of the development, technical details about the ASHP and solar PV in line with GLA's planning guidance for preparing energy assessments, March 2016 and appendix B of Ealing energy statement guidance shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

B) Within three-months of the practical completion of the development, Energy Performance Certificates and detailed modelling output reports showing clearly the BER/TER from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

C) Within three-months of the practical completion of the development, evidence that the renewable/low carbon technologies, if incorporated, are certified under the Microgeneration Certification Scheme (MSC) and, if appropriate, complies with the Enhanced Capital Allowances (ECS) product criteria should be submitted.

D) Prior to the final completion of the development, the approved spaces shall incorporate and maintain measures to achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 37.04% (equal to 9.91 tonnesCO2/yr) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 through the following carbon emission savings as detailed in the approved Energy and Sustainability Statement V2 (26 September 2017) and additional information submitted in 30 January 2018 prepared by Cudd Bentley Consulting Ltd:

i)	energy saving measures and a combination of energy efficient gas boilers and air to air ASHPs to provide space heating, hot water and cooling to achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 0.71 tonnes CO2 equating to 2.65% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the compliant BR Part L 2013 base case.

ii)	Installation of solar Photovoltaic system with a total panel area of circa 158.10 sq.m and capacity of at least 25.575kWp to supply at least 17.72MWh of electricity annually for the whole development and achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 9.20 tonnes CO2 equating to 34.39% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the Be Lean case of the Energy Hierarchy.

E) 	Measures to reduce the carbon dioxide emissions associated with other energy uses not covered by Building Regulations (un-regulated) should be incorporated prior to occupation and maintained in the development in perpetuity as detailed in the Energy and Sustainability Statement V2 (26 September 2017) .
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.

Reason:  To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.

| Prior to the first occupation of the development, the approved building shall incorporate and maintain Ultra low-NOx boilers gas boiler(s) for the provision of the hot water requirements with dry NOx Emissions below 30 mg/kWh in line with the Sustainable Design and Construction SPG  (April 2014).

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3 of the London Plan 2015, policies LV5.2 of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG, April 2014.

| The development hereby permitted shall be built in accordance with the surface water management strategy in the Flood Risk Assessment (prepared by Bradbrook and dated September 2017), with any agreed revisions to that document and any drawings approved subsequently by the Council as a local planning authority pursuant to any conditions on this decision letter. The approved drainage works shall be implemented prior to the occupation of the development hereby approved.

Reason: To prevent flooding elsewhere by ensuring that sufficient storage of surface flood water is provided and achieved with appropriate sustainable drainage techniques, in accordance policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012); policy LV 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policies 5.12 and 5.13 of the London Plan (2016); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Prior to occupation of the development, a maintenance plan should be submitted to demonstrate that the surface water drainage system will be suitably managed for the lifetime of the development. The development shall be maintained in accordance with these details in perpetuity.

Reason: To prevent flooding elsewhere by ensuring that sufficient storage of surface flood water is provided and achieved with appropriate sustainable drainage techniques, in accordance policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012); policy LV 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policies 5.12 and 5.13 of the London Plan (2016); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| The tree works and landscaping details hereby approved shall be implemented in accordance with the details shown on drawing No. 730.19.01. All tree protection methods shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the site.

The soft landscaping details as approved shall be laid out and planted within the first planting season following the first occupation of the development. Any trees or plants which within 5 years of planting, die, are removed or become seriously damaged, malformed or diseased shall be replaced with others of the same size, species, quality and in the same positions within the next planting season. The landscaping shall thereafter be maintained and managed.

Reason: To secure protection of trees, shrubs and hedges growing within the site which is of amenity and ecological value to the area and to ensure that the development is landscaped in the visual and ecological interests of the area in accordance with policy 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and policies 7.4, 7.5 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended), the development shall only be used for bus depot uses and not for any other use without prior approval of the Local Planning Authority obtained by the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To accord with the terms of the application and to protect the strategic industrial status of this Preferred Industrial Location, in accordance with policy 1.2(b) of the Ealing Core Strategy; and policy 2.17 of the London Plan (2016).

| The development hereby permitted shall be built and operated in accordance with the conclusions of the submitted Ecological Assessment (September 2017) and any details approved subsequently by the Council as a local planning authority pursuant to any conditions on this decision letter.

Reason: To support and mitigate the potential harm to ecology within the nearby Site of Importance for Nature Conservation in accordance with policy 11 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), policy 7.19 of the London Plan (2016), policy 5.11 of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policy 5.4 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012.

| The development hereby permitted shall be built in accordance with the submitted External Lighting Assessment (September 2017) and any details approved subsequently by the Council as a local planning authority pursuant to any conditions on this decision letter.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of nearby properties, in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026 and policy 7A of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

| Prior the first occupation of the development, a Parking Management Plan that details the allocation of parking spaces, on-site parking controls and enforcement of unauthorised parking on the site shall be submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall be implemented before the development permitted is occupied and maintained thereafter.

Reason: In the interest of an appropriate operation of the development in accordance with policies 1.1(e) (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A  of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 6.11, 6.12 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| No development shall take place until a Construction Management Plan has been submitted and approved in writing by the local planning authority, which will include information on:
a)	Parking of vehicles
b)	Loading and unloading of plant and materials used in constructing the development
c)	Storage of plant and materials used in construction
d)	Measures on site to control mud/dirt on surrounding roads during construction
e)	Details of times, routes and means of access and egress for construction traffic and delivery vehicles
The approved Construction Management Plan shall be adhered to throughout the construction process unless otherwise agreed in writing with the local planning authority.

Reason:  To protect the amenity of neighbouring occupiers, to ensure adequate highway and site safety in accordance with policies 1.1(e)(j) and 2.1(c) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 6.3, 6.13, 7.13, 7.14 and 7.15  of the London Plan (2015), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.

| The development hereby permitted shall be built and operated in accordance with the mitigation measures for air quality set out in the submitted Air Quality Screening Statement (by TRC Companies Ltd dated September 2017) and any details approved subsequently by the Council as a local planning authority pursuant to any conditions on this decision letter.

Reason: In the interests of the health of future occupiers of the application site and adjoining sites, in accordance with policies policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
